answers.answer: Hi ReeRee, sorry to here that, i hope things improve for you..Have you had the thyroid blood test, see how you thyroid function is?  Dawn

It sounds like you might have an autoimmune thyroid disease.  As Dawn said, you should try to get your thyroid levels tested - ask for Free T3, Free T4 and TSH, since you've already had the antibody tests.....Depending on how low your B12 is, you might need to start injections.  I self inject every 2 weeks and it makes a world of difference.What symptoms do you have?I think I'd ask for a referral to an endocrinologist, but make sure you get one that specializes in thyroid, not just diabetes as a lot of them do..........

question: I just received test results  that show my Thyrogobulin Anitbody 178.3.The Thyroid Peroxidase (TPO) Ab 42.7.    My Neurologist doesn't know what to do for me.  She was looking for LES.  She hasn't refered me to any other doctor, I feel I am going to die.  I have breast cancer that has masticized to my lungs but they say it isn't the cancer making me so sick.  My B12 is low. Help me.
title: anti-TPO antibodies
